Name: silva s
Title: very small museum
Review: A small museum within residency. did not attract us much. The rifle and canon shots in wall have been preserved here.

Name: John Muriango
Title: Alright
Review: As you visit the British Residency, make sure to also visit this site within it and you'll definitely learn a lot especially if you're a history junkie.

Name: pilgrim_gsa
Title: Awadh and 1857
Review: Though ill kept yet the displays are worth the visit  what with many cpis of original sketches  of the period  that weave their own story .They also show  a film n residency at specified hours and if around stay to see this .One's bags need to be kept out  so be prepared .

Name: Tanvi
Title: Dedicated to first war of Independence
Review: It is dedicated to first war of Independence . It contained photos , maps and paintings related to war . Visit this place if u love history .

Name: Reyan11
Title: Treasure
Review: Part of main residency building. It includes some old photographs , maps and paintings of major sites associated with the rebellion

Name: durham05
Title: Poor museum
Review: This museum is within  the residentiary and is pretty poor with very few original artifacts on display. Model was badly labelled. Maiming pictures of those involved in the 1857 siege.

Name: niya27
Title: Great museum
Review: This museum is in the middle of British Residency and there is no separate ticket for this museum. The museum exhibits many paintings and photos in the era of 1857. Remember to go in the basement.

Name: William899
Title: Excellent 1857 artefacts
Review: The museum is located at the centre of the 1857 seige estate and it has some brilliant memorabilia from that time with documents, portraits, artefacts etc.. Photography is permitted and the rooms are light and airey.

Name: felicityjg1
Title: Part of the Residency
Review: Definitely worth a visit whilst at the Residency.  The pictures are excellent.  There is also a short video.

Name: 592abck
Title: History but nothing great
Review: History but nothing great. One can spend good time but nothing much to see here. Kids got bored and we left

Name: Rohit T
Title: Heritage of Lucknow
Review: A must visit while on trip to Residency at Lucknow. Many British portraits and model of Residency is tere. Takes about 15 minutes to finish the trip.

Name: Mukesh G
Title: Informative
Review: 1857 Memorial Museum is a good place to get information about the history. specially war of independence.

Name: mkeshav
Title: War memorial
Review: A great place to visit to learn about the first war of independence , someone who likes history , will surly enjoy visiting this place and read about war .

Name: Dalbir_S_Virdi
Title: Memories of War of Independence
Review: As I mentioned in my review of Residency, this is the only active building inside Residency complex where you will get to see a complete Model of Residency (as it used to be), some paintings and pictures that will make you feel pride about those who started the war of Independence.

Name: Robert G
Title: Great background to the history of the siege
Review: There's a more than a little poetic licence in the narrative of some of the exhibits; "war of independence" is stretching things somewhat, given that only one region of India was involved in the uprising, for example.However, the tragic history is well documented in the museum and the atmospheric ruins tell their story.

Name: sid_ups
Title: A small museum with Historical weapons
Review: This museum is the part of British Residency. This part or museum is in a very small area, inside the museum you will see the map of British residency and full history, Photography is allowed but you have to deposit your baggage.

Name: Seema H
Title: 1857, memorial museum, Residency
Review: The boys wanted to visit the war museum, so we took them to the 1857, memorial museum, located in the residency premises. It is an ASI protected monument, and though now in ruins, it reflects the ambience of a bygone era.There are several galleries here, with several interesting artifacts Well worth a visit for history lovers

Name: AsisBandyopadhyay
Title: Remnants of India's first war of Independence
Review: A small museum that recreates the mutiny hours at the residency with visual descriptions, weaponry  and artifacts of the time. The human characters and geographic details of the place are depicted realistically.

Name: 810wanderwoman
Title: Interesting little museum about a sad, terrible event.
Review: The photos and maps inside, the stories of individual bravery andsuffering make for a poignant visit, fascinating in a grim, weary way.

Name: authorneelesh
Title: just some pictures and maps
Review: Located inside the residency complex it is a good quick see through as it has some maps and pictures of the area giving you some idea about the grandeur of the place as well as about the siege in 1857

Name: AmitTraveller2016
Title: Nice Museum...
Review: A nice place for museum lovers. The place is ideal to recall the memories of first fight for independence of India. The museum is nice and well maintained. Thought museum is not that big but worth a visit.

Name: Manish B
Title: First War of Indian Independence
Review: The museum at residency is the reminder of the first war of independence by indians against the Britishers. The exhibits present the story of 1857 in a chronological order and gives deep impact to visitors.  Highly recommended place to visit.

Name: sumantra_travel
Title: 1857 Memorial Museum, 19 Sep'15
Review: 19 September, 2015.One of the prime highlights of our tour of the city was a visitto the 1857 Memorial Museum, co-located inside the BritishResidency, Lucknow. The small, but extremely well-maintainedmuseum does not allow visitors to take cameras, or mobile phonesinside the premises: the above items have to be left behind inlockers, located conveniently outside the pathway to the maingate. The museum is located centrally inside one of the mainbuildings in the British Residency. There are cannons outside theentrance. The museum chronicles the events in the First War ofIndian Independence, of 1857, in historical documents,photographs, lithographs, paintings, and arms and ammunition ofthe era. A number of historical maps also trace the chronologicalorder in which the events of the uprising happened, over the area.The museum includes a model of the Residency itself, in one ofthe rooms. One of the rooms has a bas relief of Ms. SusannaPalmer, who had died due to a cannon ball hitting the room: thepoint of impact of the shell in the building can still be seen.

Name: Arpit141
Title: Great Museum
Review: Among the most popular tourist attractions in Lucknow, museums in Lucknow feature in a big way. The museums are a virtual treasure trove that offers the tourists an insight into the major historical events that have been instrumental in shaping the future course of Lucknow. 1857 Memorial Museum, Residency in Lucknow is one of the most famous Lucknow museums that are often visited by the tourists during their Lucknow Tour.

Name: chetan1586
Title: War of 1857 Museum
Review: 1857 Memorial Museum is a very good repository of the historical artifacts related to the Independence war. This is a must visit for all history lovers to revisit the war with photographs & artifacts of that time

Name: ApurbaRoy
Title: museum
Review: A good collection of the Historical artifacts reminding  the war of 1857. Of course not much clean as compared to many other museums seen.

Name: Aloy M
Title: Reminds of the First War of Independence
Review: A very good collection of the Historical artifacts from the vestiges of the Residency reminding of the war of 1857. A little cleanliness will be better appreciated. But the sheer historical importance of the articles displayed outweighs any other negatives. A must visit for any Indian to Lucknow. Reminds of at least the first Collective effort for the Independence by the Otherwise divided Indians!
